### Syllabus

| Module | Title/Topic Area | Key Contents |
|--------|------------------|--------------|
| **1** | Introduction | Basics of machine models and data models; data structures and algorithms; models of computation; computational modeling of real-world phenomena; simulations and learning |
| **2** | Problem Solving & Algorithms | Algorithms: termination & correctness; algorithm-to-program process; problem specification; decomposition and refinement; structured programming; data & control abstractions |
| **3** | Functional Paradigm | Function abstractions; designing functions as abstractions; higher-order functions; recursion and tree recursion |
| **4** | Abstractions with Data | Data abstraction; sequences; mutable data structures |
| **5** | Algorithmic Complexity | Time & space complexity; efficiency issues; searching & sorting algorithm examples |
| **6** | Object-Oriented Paradigm | Classes & objects; object abstraction; inheritance; recursive objects (linked lists, trees); graph data model |
| **7** | Data Representation & Visualization | Working with experimental and structured data |
| **8** | Numerical Computation | Simulations, interpolation, optimization; solving systems of equations; accuracy, convergence, efficiency considerations |
| **9** | Machine Learning Paradigm | Intro to ML; linear classification and regression |
| **10** | Logic Programming Paradigm | Declarative logic programs; goal & constraint satisfaction; backtracking; unification |
| **11** | Advanced Computing Paradigms | Parallel computing; quantum computing |
